intro: Phoradendron greggii, commonly known as the Gregg's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on various host trees in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Loranthaceae family and has a distinctive appearance with smooth, dark green leaves and small, white or pale flowers. The plant produces fleshy, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Its parasitic nature allows it to absorb water and nutrients from its host, while still performing photosynthesis to some extent.
